alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 6:09AM EDT until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Lower Rouge River At Dearborn affecting Wayne County. North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens affecting Macomb County. Clinton River Near Clinton Township affecting Macomb County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Rouge River Near Dearborn Heights affecting Wayne County. .Recent heavy rainfall has caused the rises on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Clinton River Near Clinton Township. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest at moderate flood early today. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Impact...At 17.0 feet, Water dams up against the Garfield, Utica and Hayes Road bridges, causing the river level on the upstream side of the bridges to be higher than what the river gauge will read downstream. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
